item.title: 美国通胀小幅回升不会阻碍美联储 9 月降息
item.description: 美国 7 月份的通胀可能略有回升，但不足以使美联储放弃普遍预期的下月降息。【原文：US inflation probably picked up modestly in July, but not enough to derail the Federal Reserve from a widely anticipated interest-rate cut next month.】

item.title: 私人信贷希望提高贷款利润率：信贷周刊
item.description: 过去一周全球市场的动荡让私人信贷基金开始质疑，他们是否应该重新考虑日益紧缩的贷款利润率要求。【原文：The turmoil in global markets this past week is causing private credit funds to question whether they should reconsider the ever-tighter loan margins they’re demanding.】

item.title: 美联储鲍曼认为存在通胀上行风险，对缩表发出谨慎信号
item.description: 美联储理事米歇尔-鲍曼（Michelle Bowman）表示，她仍然认为通胀存在上行风险，劳动力市场也将继续保持强劲，这表明她可能还没有准备好在 9 月份美国央行行长下次会议上支持降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman said she still sees upside risks for inflation and continued strength in the labor market, signaling she may not be ready to support an interest-rate decrease when US central bankers next meet in September.】

item.title: 华尔街周良好的经济与过热的交易员
item.description:
市场的剧烈波动刺激了有关美联储紧急降息的讨论，但市场的混乱掩盖了美国经济的潜在 实力。【原文：

Wild market fluctuations spurred talk of an emergency Fed rate cut, but the market mayhem belies the underlying strength of the US economy.

】

item.title: 美国科技巨头之外的盈利增长终现端倪
item.description: 随着美国企业的又一个季度财报季进入最后冲刺阶段，有一点是显而易见的：那些被人工智能狂潮遗忘的公司，期待已久的复苏终于开始了。【原文：As another quarterly earnings season from Corporate America enters its final stretch, this much is clear: The long-awaited recovery in the companies that were left out of the artificial-intelligence frenzy has finally begun.】

item.title: 蒂森克虏伯在钢铁业未来之争中出售钢铁厂股份
item.description: 蒂森克虏伯股份公司（Thyssenkrupp AG）的钢铁部门计划出售德国一家工业基地的股份，此前该部门的监事会会议结束，但未就更广泛的重组达成一致。【原文：Thyssenkrupp AG’s steel unit plans to sell a stake in an industrial site in Germany after a supervisory board meeting ended without agreement on a broader restructuring of the ailing division.】

item.title: 财政部长要求印度银行在资金紧张时增加存款
item.description: 随着家庭储蓄日益转向投资产品，印度财政部长尼尔马拉-西塔拉曼（Nirmala Sitharaman）呼吁贷款机构专注于核心业务，并探索吸引存款的新方法。【原文：Indian Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman called on lenders to focus on their core business and explore new ways to attract deposits, as household savings increasingly shift toward investment products.】

item.title: 力拓塞尔维亚锂矿开采项目面临新抗议
item.description: 环保活动人士和反对派组织将于周六在塞尔维亚首都市中心集会，要求力拓集团停止耗资 24 亿美元开设欧洲最大锂矿的计划。【原文：Environmental activists and opposition groups are set to gather in the center of Serbia’s capital on Saturday to demand a halt to the Rio Tinto Group’s $2.4 billion plans to open Europe’s biggest lithium mine.】

item.title: 孟加拉国中央银行行长在抗议声中辞职
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，孟加拉国央行行长阿卜杜勒-鲁夫-塔鲁克德（Abdur Rouf Talukder）已经辞职。【原文：Bangladesh Bank Governor Abdur Rouf Talukder has resigned, according to people familiar with the matter, just days after protesters stormed the central bank’s headquarters amid political upheaval in the country.】

item.title: 展望资本公司为其记录辩护，称其能够获得资金
item.description: 私人贷款公司 Prospect Capital Corp. 为其 20 年的业绩记录进行了辩护，回击了对其频繁使用允许借款人以更多债务支付利息的安排以及依赖个人投资者融资的批评。【原文：Private lender Prospect Capital Corp. defended its 20-year track record, pushing back against criticism over its frequent use of arrangements that allow borrowers to pay interest with more debt and its reliance on individual investors for funding.】

item.title: 中国的 WeRide 寻求在美国 IPO 和配售中募集高达 4.4 亿美元的资金
item.description: 中国自动驾驶汽车公司 WeRide Inc. 正寻求在美国首次公开募股和同时进行的私募中筹集高达 4.4 亿美元的资金。【原文：WeRide Inc., a Chinese self-driving automotive company, is seeking to raise as much as $440 million in a US initial public offering and concurrent private placement.】

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行前首席财务官起诉银行，否认与同事有染
item.description: 加拿大皇家银行前首席财务官以不当解雇为由提起诉讼，认为银行因她与一名同事的私人关系而解雇她是一个 "毁灭性 "的错误，并否认两人是恋人关系。【原文：Royal Bank of Canada’s former chief financial officer is suing for wrongful dismissal, arguing the bank made a “devastating” error when it fired her over a personal relationship with a co-worker — and denying that the two were romantic partners.】

item.title: 夏威夷电力公司因茂宜岛火灾协议损失 17 亿美元
item.description: 夏威夷电气工业公司（Hawaiian Electric Industries Inc.该公司发布了持续经营警告。【原文：Hawaiian Electric Industries Inc. said losses resulting from estimated liabilities stemming from one of the worst wildfires in US history were seen at $1.7 billion. The company issued a going-concern warning.】

item.title: 全球市场在被迫抛售的一周内狂飙突进
item.description: 事情的起因很简单，在市场上，高歌猛进的科技股开始回吐涨幅，几乎整个华尔街都认为这些股票涨得太猛了。【原文：It started, innocently enough, in markets, when high-flying tech stocks started giving back gains that nearly all of Wall Street was convinced had gone too far.】

item.title: 对日元的押注大跌，因为波动性令拥挤的套利交易感到恐慌
item.description: 美国商品期货交易委员会（Commodity Futures Trading Commission）的最新数据显示，在日元汇率剧烈波动、市场大幅下挫的情况下，投机交易商大幅削减了对日元走软的押注。【原文：Speculative traders sharply pulled back on bets for a weaker yen amid wild swings in the Japanese currency and a vicious market selloff, according to the latest Commodity Futures Trading Commission data.】

item.title: 对冲基金至少自 2011 年以来最看空大宗商品
item.description: 对冲基金对大宗商品价格的看跌程度是至少 13 年来最高的，因为人们担心经济会进一步放缓，从而对从原油到金属和谷物等各种商品的需求产生怀疑。【原文：Hedge funds are the most bearish on commodities prices in at least 13 years as fears of a deeper economic slowdown cast doubts on demand for everything from crude oil to metals and grains.】

item.title: 战神公司考虑收购合作伙伴支持的 Form Technologies 公司
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，Ares Management Corp. 公司正在探索收购工业制造商 Form Technologies 公司的可能性。【原文：Ares Management Corp. is exploring a potential buyout of industrial manufacturer Form Technologies, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司首席执行官称马塔里佩炼油厂回购并非优先事项
item.description: 巴西国家石油公司首席执行官玛格达-尚布里亚特（Magda Chambriard）对巴西国家石油公司将从阿布扎比主权财富基金合作伙伴的投资部门穆巴达拉资本（Mubadala Capital）手中回购马塔里佩炼油厂的预期泼了一盆冷水。【原文：Petrobras’s Chief Executive Officer Magda Chambriard poured cold water on expectations that Petrobras will buy back the Mataripe Refinery from Mubadala Capital, the investment arm of Abu Dhabi’s sovereign wealth fund Partners.】

item.title: 奇趣通讯：本周发生的一些事情
item.description: 您好，欢迎阅读《奇货》周刊，乔-魏森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）将为您带来他们对市场、金融和经济领域最有趣发展的看法。【原文：Hello and welcome to the weekly Odd Lots newsletter, where Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway bring you their thoughts on the most interesting developments in markets, finance and the economy.】

item.title: 嘉能可原油交易员乔治将在七年后离开公司
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Glencore Plc 的亚历山大-乔治（Alexander George）在为该公司从事美国原油交易七年后即将离职。【原文：Glencore Plc’s Alexander George, who traded US crude oil for the firm, is exiting the company after seven years, according to people with knowledge of the situation.】

item.title: 狂热交易日的 ETF
item.description:
在周一的大跌中什么起了作用？另外，加密货币基金的表现如何？【原文：

What worked during Monday’s selloff? Plus, how did crypto funds fare? 

】

item.title: 前苏格兰皇家银行交易员被判刑，长达十年的债券调查终告结束
item.description: 一名前苏格兰皇家银行证券公司（RBS Securities Inc.【原文：A former RBS Securities Inc. trader who pleaded guilty in a decade-old crackdown on questionable bond sales was spared further punishment by a federal judge, providing a quiet bookend to a prosecution that shocked Wall Street.】

item.title: 伊石油在推进页岩油开采过程中加大撤资力度，出售旗下公司
item.description: 阿根廷国营石油公司 YPF SA 正在着手出售多个业务部门和股权，该公司的撤资计划旨在集中精力发展瓦卡穆埃尔塔页岩矿区。【原文：Argentina’s state-run oil company, YPF SA, is moving to sell several business units and stakes as a divestment plan aimed at focusing its efforts on heralded shale patch Vaca Muerta gathers steam.】

item.title: 哈萨克斯坦对卡扎甘石油巨头的索赔增至 1600 亿美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，哈萨克斯坦对开发卡沙干油田的国际石油巨头集团提出的仲裁索赔金额已超过 1,600 亿美元，因为哈萨克斯坦指控某些交易存在腐败问题。【原文：Kazakhstan’s arbitration claims against a group of international oil majors that developed the Kashagan field escalated above $160 billion after the country alleged some deals were tainted by corruption, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 克利夫兰抵制新体育馆计划，布朗队体育场紧张局势加剧
item.description: 克利夫兰正面临着失去其长期效力的美国国家橄榄球联盟球队的风险，因为双方对体育场的愿景各执一词。【原文：Cleveland is at risk of losing its longtime National Football League team over competing visions for a stadium.】

item.title: 萨默斯呼吁美国证券交易委员会和交易所调查周一 VIX 指数飙升事件
item.description: 前财政部长劳伦斯-萨默斯（Lawrence Summers）周一敦促美国证券交易委员会（Securities and Exchange Commission）和相关交易所调查最受关注的美国金融波动性指标历史性的飙升。【原文：Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers urged the Securities and Exchange Commission and relevant exchanges to look into the historic surge in the most-watched gauge of US financial volatility on Monday.】

item.title: 法国银行称奥运会将推动法国经济增长
item.description: 法国中央银行的月度调查显示，巴黎奥运会将推动法国第三季度经济加速增长。【原文：The Paris Olympics will drive an acceleration in French economic growth in the third quarter, according to a monthly survey by the country’s central bank.】

item.title: 合作伙伴集团考虑在 9 月启动 Techem 首次公开募股
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Partners Group Holding AG 正在考虑最快于 9 月份启动德国计量公司 Techem GmbH 的首次公开募股。【原文：Partners Group Holding AG is considering a launch of the initial public offering of German metering company Techem GmbH as soon as September, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 美联储降息在即，美国银行客户转而反对美元
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America）的一项调查显示，在过去一个月里，随着市场为美联储降息做准备，相信美元将走软的投资者比例几乎增加了两倍。【原文：The share of investors who are convinced the dollar will weaken has almost tripled over the past month as the market braces for interest-rate cuts from the Federal Reserve, according to a Bank of America survey.】

item.title: 波动率专家称周一创纪录的 VIX 指数飙升是假象
item.description: 从表面上看，这是一场旷世股灾，是一代人中罕见的激荡，在全球市场引起了强烈反响。但是，如果周一的剧烈波动事件并不像看上去那样呢？【原文：On the surface it was a stock shock for the ages, a once-in-a-generation spike in turbulence that reverberated through global markets. But what if Monday’s extreme volatility event wasn’t quite what it seemed?】
